intro: Tithonia heterophylla, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in warm climates and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant appearance. Tithonia heterophylla is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
